comment: If the metric ` M ` is "strongly finer" than ` N ` (meaning that there is a positive real constant ` R ` such that ` N ( x , y ) <_ R x. M ( x , y ) ` ), then total boundedness of ` M ` implies total boundedness of ` N ` . (Using this theorem twice in each direction states that if two metrics are strongly equivalent, then one is totally bounded iff the other is.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Sep-2015.)
